You wouldn't have known that at the beginning. But you are right, just to know the facts of the specifics of the containment effort is what's important.

utterances.speaker: HAYES
utterances.utterance: It's a difficult thing to talk about in part because the people who have it may not have had it detected. It's unlike SARS or MERS or Ebola where the symptoms are manifest and they are often deadly. This is not, and so people could walk around undetected without anybody knowing that they are potentially being exposed. I think that makes it difficult. On the one hand it's must less serious. The irony of it being much less serious on an individual patient basis means that the potential for spread is greater.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Quickly, I just want to get the John Ratcliffe being announced as the nominee for DNI.

utterances.speaker: HEMINGWAY
utterances.utterance: This is very interesting news. He'd been previously nominated and pulled his own nomination, and he's been re-nominated. This is a guy who came up to speed pretty quickly on the House Permanent Select Committee of Intelligence. He really is known by his colleagues as someone who is very dutiful and has been looking in the right places in terms of oversights for how this crazy conspiracy theory of treasonous collusion with Russia took root. It's also why a lot of people are worried about having him there is that he understands how the intelligence community works, knows the need for reform, and seems intent on actually getting that done.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: We'll follow it. Next up, the Friday lightning round. We will talk politics. Candidate Casino, remember that? Plus Winners and Losers.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, (D-VT) PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: The American people are tired of billionaires, whether it's Michael Bloomberg or anyone else trying to buy elections.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL BLOOMBERG, (D) FORMER NEW YORK MAYOR
utterances.utterance: I will vote for the Democratic candidate even if it's Bernie Sanders. The other day his staff for reasons beyond me said we don't want Bloomberg's help. So I guess I'm off the hook there.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: What about money, cash on hand? Take a look at this. Through January 31st, Mayor Bloomberg, obviously he has a lot of cash on hand. It's not really measured here. But Joe Biden, $7 million down there. Candidate spending, again, Bloomberg, $409 million so far. Tom Steyer, $253 million. Biden at $62 million. We're back to the panel. We're going to first go down to a place we call candidate casino, but it's the South Carolina version of Candidate Casino. We start with Steve Hayes. You have $100 in chips. South Carolina, here we go.

utterances.speaker: HAYES
utterances.utterance: That's an extraordinary amount of spending for the party that wants to remove money from politics, I would just point out. I think this is basically a two-man race. I've got $65 on Joe Biden, $35 on Bernie. I wouldn't put it past a surprise from Bernie, a better than expected performance from Bernie.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Leslie?

utterances.speaker: MARSHALL
utterances.utterance: I'm putting $90 on Joe Biden and $10 on Bernie. Although I would agree it would be a surprise, because is it going to be a 20-point spread or a four-point spread depending on what poll and what time of the day you look at it. But I think Biden will pull it off.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Mollie?

utterances.speaker: HEMINGWAY
utterances.utterance: Leslie, we agree for the second time tonight, $90 on Biden, $10 on Sanders. I think Biden needs to not just win but win big. And so I'm very excited to see how it goes.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't have bet on that, you agreeing twice.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: All right, 2020 candidate casino, a different bet, $100, here we go.

utterances.speaker: HAYES
utterances.utterance: Even if Joe Biden wins South Carolina I don't think he's likely to win the Democrat nomination, so I've got $75 on Bernie Sanders, $15 on Joe Biden, and $10 on something kind of crazy happening at the convention, and who knows what that will be.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Wine, women, and song. OK.

utterances.speaker: MARSHALL
utterances.utterance: I'm going to split it 50-50, 50 bucks on each of them. Every day I change my mind.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: There's nobody else?

utterances.speaker: MARSHALL
utterances.utterance: No, I think it's going to be one of them. I really do.

utterances.speaker: HEMINGWAY
utterances.utterance: I have $50 on Sanders, who I think is the guy most suited to get the nomination. But I also have $25, which is my next largest bet, on none of these candidates making it to getting the nomination. I think if you are not going to give it to Sanders, you might not be able to give it to any of them. And $10 each on Biden and Bloomberg, and I did put $5 on wine, woman, and song, because we all could use some fun.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: A hat-tip to the late Charles Krauthammer. OK, Winners and Losers, quickly down the row. Steve?

utterances.speaker: HAYES
utterances.utterance: My winner is the Taliban. They're getting Afghanistan back, and I think we are likely to whitewash their radicalism as we withdraw. The loser is your 401(k).

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Sad clown. OK.

utterances.speaker: MARSHALL
utterances.utterance: I'm going to do it opposite. Loser, I'm going to say Donald Trump Jr. for saying that myself and other Democrats would actually want coronavirus to be inflicted on people for political gain -- paraphrasing. And in light of black history month, Olivia Hooker.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Is the winner.

utterances.speaker: MARSHALL
utterances.utterance: Is the winner yes. She hid under her table at six years of age while white people destroyed her house, worked for civil rights, became the first African-American female in the Coast Guard.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Nice. Winner and loser?

utterances.speaker: HEMINGWAY
utterances.utterance: My winner are the Democratic superdelegates who really do seem poised to play a huge role in who gets the nomination. They always have had an outsized role, but here they could actually determine it. We had stories this week showing how much they were interested in keeping Bernie Sanders, the presumptive plurality getter of votes, from getting the nomination, and so they will play a key role.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Although if you are a Sanders supporter, they are the loser, potentially.

utterances.speaker: HEMINGWAY
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm not saying they're great or bad. I'm just saying they're the winners of the week.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HEMINGWAY
utterances.utterance: My loser would be the Democratic debate moderators who seem to match a lot of their media colleagues in being unable to ask tough questions of these candidates, whether it was Joe Biden making false claims about getting arrested in South Africa or Elizabeth Warren changing and flip-flopping on PACs, or really just any good tough questions about how to deal with coronavirus. We are not seeing our best questioning of these candidates.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Winners, you guys, made it around the horn very quickly. Finally tonight, we have "Notable Quotables."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: God knew they couldn't be on this earth without each other. He had to bring them home to have them together.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: President Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, (R) PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: As the great religious teacher Swami Vivekananda once said. Namaste, namaste.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's all about the virus on Wall Street, on main street, and, yes, on Pennsylvania Avenue.

utterances.speaker: CHUCK SCHUMER, (D) SENATE MINORITY LEADER
utterances.utterance: President Trump, good morning. There's a pandemic of coronavirus. Where are you? Where is your plan?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Wash her hands. Stay clean. You don't necessarily have to grab every handrail, unless you have to.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, (D-VT) PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: When Fidel Castro came to office, you know what he did? He had a massive literacy program. Is that a bad thing?

utterances.speaker: PETE BUTTIGIEG, (D) PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Imagine spending the better part of 2020 with Bernie Sanders versus Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: SANDERS
utterances.utterance: First of all -

utterances.speaker: MIKE PENCE, U.S. VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: That wasn't a Democratic debate. That was a demolition derby. STEPHEN COLBERT, HOST, "THE LATE SHOW": Let's imagine I'm a billionaire and these ribs are my money. How many of my ribs would you take away?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, (D) PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: My name is Joe Biden and I'm a Democratic candidate for the United States Senate.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: He said I have the worst fever in the worst way. And he's hugging and kissing me. So I said, excuse me, I went and I started washing my hands.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: One week, and we have a busy weekend and week ahead. Tomorrow, we will have special coverage of the South Carolina primary. I'll be anchoring that. And then Sunday, "FOX News Sunday," Chris Wallace will interview former vice president Joe Biden. Check your local listings there for showtimes. Monday, Martha MacCallum and I will host a town hall with presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg ahead of the Super Tuesday primaries, then we have Super Tuesday, and then on Thursday, we have another big town hall, this time with President Trump in Scranton, Pennsylvania. You'll want to tune in for that. Thanks for inviting us into your home tonight. That's it for this SPECIAL REPORT, fair, balanced, and still unafraid. "The Story" hosted by Martha MacCallum, whose book, by the way, spectacular, starts after the break. Content and Programming Copyright 2020 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
